para0.title: Introduction.
para0.para: The following paragraphs will describe the Test Program Instructions (TPI) for the Gun Turret Drive (GTD) Stabilization System Processor (P/N 16102218-061). The GTD testing is divided into one of two tests:

subpara1.title: VIPER/T Test Program Instructions.
subpara1.para: Table 4-10 provides information on the equipment required to test VIPER/T.

table.title: Table 4-10. GTD Stabilization System Processor, VIPER/T Required Equipment

caution.para: UUT contains electrostatic sensitive devices (ESDs). Failure to follow ESD handling procedures may result in damage to equipment.

para0.para: UUT contains electrostatic sensitive devices (ESDs). Failure to follow ESD handling procedures may result in damage to equipment.

step1.para: 1. Open the ATE interface handle.
2. Insert Interface Device (P/N 13020A1000) into the ATE interface receiver.
3. Close the ATE interface handle.
4. Place Holding Fixture (P/N 13020A9015) on top of ID. Secure to holding cleat with thumb screw.
5. Loosen both top knobs so that the rail slides freely. Adjust position of rail so that the UUT will sit firmly on both lips. Secure both knobs to retain UUT.
6. Connect W7 (P/N 13020A7700) P1 to ID J1.
7. Connect W7 P2 to UUT J1.
8 Connect W7 P3 to UUT J2.
9. Connect W7 P4 to ATE Secondary Chassis 1A2 BUS I/O.
10. Connect W8 (P/N 08014A3800) P1 to ATE Instrument Controller 1A5J6.

note.para: DO NOT connect W8 P2 until prompted to do so after Safe To Turn On.

step1.para: 11. Connect ATE W204 (P/N 93006H6048) P1 to ATE Secondary Chassis 1A2 S/R IO.
12. Connect ATE W204 cable P2 to ID J3.

subpara1.title: Successful Completion of Safe To Turn On Instructions.

step1.para: 1. Ensure W8 P1 is connected to Instrument Controller 1A5 J6.
2. Connect W8 P2 to ID J4 now.
1. Disconnect all cables from UUT if testing is complete.

subpara1.title: TETS-B Test Program Instructions.
subpara1.para: Table 4-11 provides information on the equipment required to test TETS-B.

table.title: Table 4-11. GTD Stabilization System Processor, TETS-B Required Equipment

caution.para: UUT contains electrostatic sensitive devices (ESDs). Failure to follow ESD handling procedures may result in damage to equipment.

para0.para: UUT contains electrostatic sensitive devices (ESDs). Failure to follow ESD handling procedures may result in damage to equipment.

step1.para: 1. Open the ATE interface handle.
2. Insert Interface Device (P/N 13020A1000) into the ATE interface receiver.
3. Close the ATE interface handle.
4. Place Holding Fixture (P/N 13020A9015) on top of ID. Secure to holding cleat with thumb screw.
5. Loosen both top knobs so that the rail slides freely. Adjust position of rail so that the UUT will sit firmly on both lips. Secure both knobs to retain UUT.
6. Connect W7 (P/N 13020A7700) P1 to ID J1.
7. Connect W7 P2 to UUT J1.
8. Connect W7 P3 to UUT J2.

note.para: Leave W7 P4 unattached. This connector is for use with the VIPER/T only.

step1.para: 9. Connect W8 (P/N 08014A3800) P1 to ATE Instrument Controller 1A5J6.

note.para: DO NOT connect W8 P2 until prompted to do so after Safe To Turn On.

step1.para: 10. Connect ATE W204 (P/N 93006H6048) P1 to ATE Secondary Chassis 1A2 S/R IO.
11. Connect ATE W204 P2 to ID J3.

subpara1.title: Successful Completion of Safe To Turn On Instructions.

step1.para: 1. Ensure W8 P1 is connected to Instrument Controller 1A5 J6.
2. Connect W8 P2 to ID J4 now.
1. Disconnect all cables from UUT if testing is complete.
